text: The EuroCup Basketball Awards are the awards given to the top individual performers of each season's edition of EuroCup Basketball, which is Europe's second-tier level continental-wide professional club basketball competition. The EuroCup is the league level that is one tier below the EuroLeague level. ==EuroCup awards== The awards are given out each season and include: the EuroCup Basketball MVP award, the EuroCup Basketball Finals MVP award, the EuroCup Basketball Rising Star award, the EuroCup Basketball Coach of the Year award, and the EuroCup Basketball All-EuroCup Team.Eurocupbasketball.com - EUROCUP 2010-11 AWARDS. ===EuroCup Basketball MVP=== The EuroCup Basketball MVP award began with the 2008–09 season. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Season !! MVP !! Team !! Ref. |- |- |2008–09 | Chuck Eidson | Lietuvos Rytas | |- |2009–10 | Marko Banić | Bilbao |2009-10 Eurocup MVP: Marko Banic, Bizkaia Bilbao Basket |- |2010–11 | Dontaye Draper | Cedevita Zagreb |2010-11 Eurocup MVP: Dontaye Draper, Cedevita Zagreb. |- |2011–12 | Patrick Beverley | Spartak St. Petersburg |2011-12 Eurocup MVP: Patrick Beverley, Spartak St. Petersburg. |- |2012–13 | Nick Calathes | Lokomotiv Kuban |2012-13 Eurocup MVP: Nick Calathes, Lokomotiv Kuban Krasnodar. |- |2013–14 | Andrew Goudelock | UNICS Kazan |2013-14 Eurocup MVP: Andrew Goudelock, Unics Kazan |- |2014–15 | Tyrese Rice | Khimki |2014-15 Eurocup MVP: Tyrese Rice, Khimki Moscow Region |- |2015–16 | Errick McCollum | Galatasaray | |- |2016–17 | Alexey Shved | Khimki || 7DAYS EuroCup MVP for 2016-17: Alexey Shved, Khimki Moscow Region. |- |2017–18 | Scottie Wilbekin | Darüşşafaka |2017-18 Eurocup MVP: Scottie Wilbekin, Darussafaka Istanbul. |- |2018–19 | Luke Sikma | Alba Berlin | |} ===EuroCup Basketball Finals MVP=== The EuroCup Basketball Finals MVP award began with the 2002–03 season. {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Season !! Finals MVP !! Team !! Ref. |- |2002–03 || Dejan Tomašević || Valencia || |- |2003–04 || Kelly McCarty || Hapoel Jerusalem || |- |2004–05 || Robertas Javtokas || Lietuvos Rytas || |- |2005–06 || Ruben Douglas || Dynamo Moscow || |- |2006–07 || Charles Smith || Real Madrid || |- |2007–08 || Rudy Fernández || Joventut Badalona || |- |2008–09 || Marijonas Petravičius || Lietuvos Rytas || |- |2009–10 || Matt Nielsen || Valencia || Matt Nielsen, MVP. |- |2010–11 || Marko Popović || UNICS Kazan || 2010-11 Eurocup Finals MVP: Marko Popović of Unics. |- |2011–12 || Zoran Planinić || Khimki || Zoran Planinic was named Eurocup Finals MVP. |- |2012–13 || Richard Hendrix || Lokomotiv Kuban || |- |2013–14 || Justin Doellman || Valencia || |- |2014–15 || Tyrese Rice || Khimki || Rice caps standout season as Eurocup Finals MVP |- |2015–16 || Stéphane Lasme || Galatasaray Odeabank || Lasme named Eurocup Finals MVP |- |2016–17 || Alberto Díaz || Unicaja || Alberto Diaz chosen MVP of EuroCup Finals. |- |2017–18 || Scottie Wilbekin || Darüşşafaka || 2018 7DAYS EuroCup Finals MVP: Scottie Wilbekin, Darussafaka Istanbul. |- |2018–19 || Will Thomas || Valencia Basket || |} ===EuroCup Basketball MVP of the Week=== The EuroCup Basketball MVP of the Week award began with the 2002–03 season. ===EuroCup Basketball Top Scorer=== ===EuroCup Basketball Rising Star=== The EuroCup Basketball Rising Star award began with the 2008–09 season. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Season !! Rising Star !! Team !! Ref. |- |2008–09 | Milan Mačvan | Hemofarm | |- |2009–10 | Víctor Claver | Valencia |2009-10 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy Victor Claver, Power Electronics Valencia |- |2010–11 | Donatas Motiejūnas | Treviso |2010-11 2010-11 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy winner: Donatas Motiejunas, Benetton Bwin. |- |2011–12 | Jonas Valančiūnas | Lietuvos Rytas |2011-12 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy winner: Jonas Valanciunas, Lietuvos Rytas |- |2012–13 | Bojan Dubljević | Valencia |2012-13 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy winner: Bojan Dubljevic, Valencia Basket. |- |2013–14 | Bojan Dubljević (2×) | Valencia |2012-13 2013-14 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy winner: Bojan Dubljevic, Valencia Basket |- |2014–15 | Kristaps Porziņģis | Sevilla |2014-15 Eurocup Rising Star Trophy winner: Kristaps Porzingis, Baloncesto Seville |- |2015–16 | Mateusz Ponitka | Zielona Góra | |- |2016–17 | Rolands Šmits | Montakit Fuenlabrada |2016-17 7DAYS EuroCup Rising Star Trophy winner: Rolands Smits, Montakit Fuenlabrada. |- |2017–18 | Džanan Musa | Cedevita |2017-18 7DAYS EuroCup Rising Star Trophy winner: Džanan Musa, KK Cedevita. |- |2018–19 | Martynas Echodas | Rytas Vilnius | |} ===EuroCup Basketball Coach of the Year=== The EuroCup Basketball Coach of the Year award began with the 2008–09 season. {|| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Season !! Coach of the Year !! Team !!
